Her daughter is learning this trade, and she and likes.  Lina has plans to get another machine so her garments will have a better finish to them.

This is her 19th loan with MFP, and she hopes to realize her plans.  She says that she feels good with her communal bank.  She considers the members to be responsible people.  She will use the requested 1,600 soles to buy sewing materials (needles for machines, thread, fabric, and others).  This way she will have available stock to do her work.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna tiene 39 años, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable. Está casada con Rubén, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus tres hijos: Alain de 23 años, Ronald de 21 años y Cindy de 11 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos, más una nuera, a los que quiere bastante.
Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes desde la bodega que implementó en su casa. Se inició con un capital propio, fruto de los ahorros con su pareja y fueron invirtiendo de a pocos, dándole una rotación constante a sus productos y logrado hacer crecer su negocio y tener una buena clientela. Lleva más de 15 años en este negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la atención a los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su  casa y tener tiempo libre para ocuparlo en otras actividades, además del ingreso económico que le sirve para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Pero lo que no le gusta es cuando sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero ella sabe que eso no debe perjudicar sus obligaciones con MFP. 
Este es su préstamo número 19, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues sus integrantes son personas puntuales con sus obligaciones de pago.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Digna is 39 years old. She is a hardworking and dynamic woman as well as a cheerful and sociable woman. She is married to Ruben, who is a merchant and the father of her three children: Alain,  23, Ronald, 21, and Cindy,11. She lives with her husband and her children, plus a daughter in law. She loves them all very much. 

Her business is selling from a little store she has set up in her house. She started with her own capital, the fruit of her saving with her spouse. They invested little by little, constantly rotating the products and creating her business and establishing a good clientele. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and so far she has had her husband's support for the customers when she is not at home. She likes what she does, because it allows her to stay in her own home and have free time to spend doing other activities. It also brings in income, which she uses to help her spouse with the household expenses. What she doesn't like is when her customers are late paying off their credit with her, but she knows that this shouldn't affect her obligations to MFP. 

This is her 19th loan, so she hopes to continue with her goals. In addition, she comments that she feels good with her communal bank, because its members make their payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, 2,5000 nuevos soles, she will buy vegetables wholesale to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Su pareja es Nicanor, quien es agricultor y el padre de sus dos hijos: Kleper de 14 años y Karen de 8 años. Juntos vive en la casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
Su negocio es la venta de mercadería variada: comestibles, medicamentos, ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y otros. Todos estos artículos los lleva a los caseríos en la rivera de los ríos, negocio que aprendió de su padre y lo hace sola desde hace 4 años. Comenzó comprando en pequeñas cantidades y ha logrado crecer a base de mucho esfuerzo. Le gusta lo que hace porque le permite tener los ingresos económicos necesarios para su hogar. Notó la oportunidad de negocio, ya que en esas zonas alejadas, la demanda es grande y los precios de los productos son elevados, por lo que se obtiene mayores ganancias.  Lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan, pero aun así viendo la buena acogida que tiene su negocio desea crecer y tener un local en su casa.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Además, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus compañeros y aunque están ingresando algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, ropa y sandalias al por mayor. También de productos de belleza para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Martha, age 31, is a very happy and hard-working woman.  Nicanor, her life partner, is a farmer.  He is the father of their two children, 14 year old Kleper and 8 year old Karen.  They live together in the house that took them a great deal of effort to buy.

Her business is selling varied merchandise like food, medicine, clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and others.  She takes all of these items to the rural communities on the riverbanks.  She learned this business from her father.  She has been doing this alone for four years.

She started by purchasing small quantities, and she has managed to grow through a lot of effort.  She likes what she does because it allows her to have the income needed for her household.  She noticed the opportunity for her business because there is a big demand in the remote areas.  The prices for products there are high, so she gets greater income.  

What she does not like is that some of her customers ask for credit, and when it comes time to pay they delay.  Even so, seeing how well-received her business is, she wishes for it to grow and to have a place in her house.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she hopes to realize her plans.  Also, she says that she feels good in her communal bank.  She knows the majority of her colleagues.  New members are joining, and she hopes that they will be as responsible as the rest of the group.

She will use the 2,000 soles she has requested to buy groceries, clothes, and sandals wholesale.  She will also buy beauty products to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy groceries, clothes, and sandals wholesale, and to buy beauty products to increase her stock.

loans.name: Duo San Juaneras Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN JUANERAS
LA señora Vidalia de 55 años de edad casada, y comerciante desde  hace 22 años, doña Vidalia cuenta con un local en el mercado municipal, donde vende ropa para bebe, ropa interior de dama, ropa para niños, ropa casual, colchas etc. Doña Vidalia también es vendedora de los productos ONMILIFE (medecina natural)el cual ella proporciona a  sus clientes que la visitan en su negocio, ambas se conocieron en los talleres que esta empres brinda a sus vendedores  en donde ellas manifiesta ha aprendido bastante y la motiva a perseverar a seguir trabajando aunque para ello ella necesitan de capital para  lograr sus objetivos  como pequeñas comerciante.
texts.en:
The SAN JUANERAS DUO

 Vidalia is 55 years old. She is married and has been a merchant for 22 years. Vidalia has a locale in the city market where she sells clothing for babies, women's underwear, children's clothing, casual wear, blankets, etc. Vidalia also sells ONMILIFE products (natural medicine) which she supplies to her customers when they visit her business. The members of this duo met in the workshops that the organization offers salespeople. They say that they learned a lot and are motivated to perservere in their work, although they need capital to meet their goals as small businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy a variety of new clothes.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la Terminal de autobuses desde hace dos años.  Aprendió el oficio debido a la necesidad de llevar el alimento a su familia, pues ella ha sido siempre una mujer muy luchadora. Los materiales para la elaboración de los alimentos los compra en el mercado central, debido a que esta cerca, compra los productos frescos y a su gusto. 

Doña Ana solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para construir una habitación a su vivienda, para que su hija que esta casada viva allí. Ella ha construido su vivienda con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su esposo que es motorista. Así ella podrá tener un hogar digno para su familia, ya que cada día se dificulta más la construcción por los costos de los materiales y los precios de la tierra. Ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida, vivir con mayor espacio y ordenado. Por supuesto que doña Ana quiere seguir en su negocio ya que la demanda proyectada incrementa y seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling food in the bus station for two years.  She learned this business because she needed to provide food for her family.  Ana has always been a very tenacious woman.  She buys the supplies that she needs for making her food in the central market because it is close by.  She buys fresh produce that is to her liking.

Ana is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to build an extra room in her home so that her married daughter can live there.  Ana and her husband, who is a driver, have put a lot of hard work into building their home.  This loan will allow Ana to have a decent home for her family to live in as building houses is becoming more difficult every day owing to the high cost of both materials and land.  She would like to improve her quality of life and have more space and order in her home.  Ana would like to continue in her business as her demand is increasing.  She would also like to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to build an extra room in her home so that her married daughter can live there

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doña Josefa de 30 años es  casada tiene dos hijos uno de ellos ya estudia, su esposo se dedica a la venta de verdura en el mercado CENMA Guatemala ya desde hace 8 años, doña Josefa se dedica a la venta de ropa típica en el mercado municipal desde hace 11 años,  las personas ya la conocen y trabaja al crédito sus ventas con sus clientes más conocidos, ya que algunas personas no pueden pagar al contado el valor de estos trajes típicos, ella solicita un nuevo crédito  para surtir su negocio con nuevos diseños de trajes que sus clientes le piden.(ropa tipica) Doña Josefa se siente feliz porque aunque hay competencia sus ventas no han bajado, ella piensa que es por el servicio que le da a sus clientes,  ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y ella menciona que se siente muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que ha recibido con los créditos que se le han otorgado en diferentes ocasiones, por lo que ella siempre cumple con sus pagos cada mes.desde ya les desea bendiciones.y gracias por su ayuda.
texts.en: Josefa is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. On eof them goes to school. Her husband has sold  vegetables in the CENMA Guatamalaya market for 8 years. Josefa has sold traditional clothing in the city market for 11 years. People knw her and she sells on credit to her the customers she knows the best, since some people can't pay the price of this traditional clothing up front. She is asking for a new loan to stock her business with new designs of the clothes her customers ask her for. Josefa is happy because although there is competition, her sales haven't gone down. She thinks it is because of the service she gives her customers. She is a very hardworking woman and says that she is very happy and grateful for the support she has received with the loans that have been given to her at different times. She always makes her payments every month. She sends you her blessings and thanks you for her help.

loans.use: to sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, aprendió el oficio de su padre, quien desde que él tubo uso de razón se dedico a ayudarle en los trabajos agrícolas por la mañana estudiaba y por las tardes se dedicaba a realizar los trabajos familiares. También aprendió el oficio de fontanero y albañil, así que él tiene distintas formas como desempeñarse trabajando para poder salir adelante. 
Don Ramón tiene un hogar bien constituido por su esposa e hijos y tiene que buscar la manera de llevar el sustento a su hogar y poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Ellos estudian en el centro escolar de la comunidad, por ese motivo él se dedica a trabajar muy duro para poder salir adelante con todos esos gastos.
 El compra los materiales que utiliza en cada uno de sus trabajos en la ciudad más cercana que esta a unos 15 kilómetros de su casa y tiene que trasladarse en autobús todo el camino y retornar a su casa de la misma manera  llevando su mercadería en el mismo medio de transporte.
 El préstamo que esta solicitando don Ramón es para comprar cemento, hierro, arena y cancelar a la persona que le ayude en la construcción, ya que el principal albañil será é. de esta manera continuara con la construcción de su vivienda, la cual ya tiene un poco avanzada pero le hace falta un poco de dinero. La principal necesidad que será satisfecha es que él podrá comprar todos los insumos que necesita para la construcción de su vivienda y así poder tener su hogar donde ir a vivir junto con su familia ya que por el momento están viviendo en la casa de la hermana mientras termina de construir su casa.
Él manifiesta que su vida mejorara, ya que el podrá terminar la construcción de su casa y tendrá un hogar digno en donde vivir junto a su familia.
Su deseo es  tener terminada su casa y poder ver a sus hijos jugar en lo propio. También planea ampliar más su vivienda, ya que continuara trabajando para poder tener un mejor ingreso y poder ampliar más su construcción y llevar siempre el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He has been involved in agriculture since childhood, having learned the trade from his father who he helped with the work around the farm. In the morning he would be studying, and then help with the family chores in the afternoon. Ramón also learned the skills required to be a plumber and bricklayer, so that he could rely on different ways of working in order to get ahead.

Don Ramón has a a good home life with his wife and children. He looks for ways to maintain his household and provide a good education for his children. They study at the central school in their community, so he has decided to work very hard to stay on top of all the expenses.

Ramón purchases materials for each of his jobs in a city that is about 15 kilometers from his house. He must travel by bus both ways and carry his merchandise using the same method of transport. Don Ramón is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, iron, and sand. He will also pay another person to help with construction since he is the primary builder. This will enable him to continue with the construction of his home, which has made a bit of progress, but he lacks the money. The main need to be satisfied is the purchase of necessary supplies for building his home. Ramón and his family are living at his sister's house at the moment until his house is completed. He says that his life will improve once the construction of his house is finished. Ramón will have a decent home where he can live with his family. His wish is to finish the construction of his house so that his children can have a place of their own to play. He also wants to expand his home even more. By continuing to work and earn more income, he will able to add more room to his house and still sustain his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, and sand, and to pay someone to assist him with building his home.

loans.name: Mujeres De Choestancia Group

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Araceli esta casada, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropas, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería, suéteres, playeras, blusas, servilletas, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio con mas variedad. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales y al comercio.
texts.en:
Sonia Araceli is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school. Sonia completed 3 years of primary education, and makes a living by selling clothes. She started this business with little capital and now she has 10 years of experience.

She organizes a group to request a loan that she will use to buy more merchandise, sweaters, sneakers, blouses, napkins, and other items. She hopes that her business will have more variety in the future. The other members of the group make a living by raising animals and commerce.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary tiene 33 años, es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de progresar. Es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus cuatro hermanos, a quienes quiere mucho y apoya en sus estudios.
Su actividad es la compra y venta de madera, la cual que adquiere en los aserraderos de su localidad y también compra a los extractores. Comparte este negocio con su padre, donde ambos invierten. Tiene más de dos años dedicándose a esto y le gusta porque le genera un ingreso económico adicional, además de realizarlo con su familia. Lo considera bastante rentable, por la demanda y el precio elevado que tiene este producto, dejándole buenas ganancias. Pero lo que no le gusta es la informalidad, deseando en un futuro poder regularizarse y aumentar sus ventas.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Además, nos comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más madera, buscando los precios más bajos por su compra al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Mary, age 33, is a very happy and hard-working woman with a great desire to progress.  She is single, and she lives in her parents’ house with her four siblings.  She loves them very much, and she supports them in their education.

Her business activity is buying and selling wood.  She gets the wood in the local sawmills.  She also buys from the tree extractors.  She shares this business with her father, and they both invest in it.  She has been doing this for over two years.  She likes it because it generates an additional income for her and because she does it with her family.

She considers it to be very profitable.  Due to the demand and the high price that this product has, it gives her good income.  What she does not like is the irregularity.  In the future she wishes to be able to make it more regular and to increase her sales.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She hopes to be able to meet her objectives.  Also, she tells us that she feels comfortable with her communal bank.  She considers the group to be united and supportive.  She will use the 1,500 soles that she requested to buy more wood.  She will be looking for lower prices because she will be buying in volume and for cash.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: La Señora Florinda se dedica a la venta de frijol  en el mercado  Municipal de Santiago Sacatepequez desde hace 8 años,  es casada y  tiene dos hijas una de ellas ya asiste a la escuela, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.   Doña Florinda vende todos los días en el mercado de 8:30 AM a 12:30 AM lunes a domingo, ya las personas del lugar la conocen y compran por libra o por cantidades mayores el frijol que ella ofrece y ya que este, es un producto que se consume diariamente por las personas, es lo que le ayuda a mantener una buena cantidad de ventas. Ella solicita este nuevo crédito para al compra de frijol por mayor  ella tiene un descuento cuando compra por mayor y asi puede tener buenos precios para sus clientes y asi obtener una ganancia justa. Ella se siente muy contenta con el apoyo que se le ha dado al otorgarle el crédito y muestra su agradecimiento con la puntualidad de sus pagos,  es una mujer emprendedora que quiere lograr darle educación a sus niñas y que ellas puedan tener una profesión.esta muy agradecida con ustedes que le dan la ayuda para que ella y su familia salgan adelante.
texts.en: Florinda has been selling beans in the town market in Santiago, Sacatepequez, for eight years.  She is married and has two daughters, one of whom attends school.  Her husband works in construction.  Florinda sells her products in the market every day, from 8.30am to 12.30pm, Monday to Sunday.  The locals know her and buy the beans that she sells either by the pound or in larger quantities.  As beans are eaten every day, she constantly makes a good number of sales.  Florinda is requesting this new loan to buy beans wholesale.  She gets a discount when she buys in bulk and this allows her to offer her customers good prices and make a fair profit.  Florinda feels very happy with the support she is receiving with these loans and shows her gratitude by making her repayments on time.  She is an entrepreneurial woman who would like to provide her daughters with an education and ensure they become professionals.  She is very grateful to you for helping both herself and her family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell wholesale and retail

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y dinámica. Está casada con Amaro, quien ya no trabaja debido a su edad, es el padre de sus tres hijos: Cesar de 28 años, Daniel de 27 años (con retardo mental) y Rosa de 23 años. Todos viven juntos en su casa propia casa.
Ella se dedica a la venta de jugos de fruta, actividad que empieza de madrugada, cuando se dirige al mercado para adquirir las frutas, las cuales compra al por mayor. Lleva 9 años con este negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos en sus ratos libres. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico, por su edad, por eso se toma descansos de hasta dos días y vuelve a su negocio. Tiene planes de construir un criadero de cerdos para darle una ocupación a su esposo y se apoyen mutuamente con las ganancias. También vende productos de belleza por catalogo.

Este es su préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP y se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con un crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues los considera personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de frutas de los productores al por mayor; también en la construcción del criadero de cerdos y la compra de una cerda preñada valorizada en 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is sixty years old and a very hardworking, happy, and dynamic woman. She's married to Amaro, who no longer works due to his age, and who is the father of their three children: Cesar, 28 years old; Daniel, 27 years old (who's mentally handicapped); and Rosa, 23 years old. All live together in their own home.

She makes a living selling fruit juice. This begins at dawn when she goes to the market to purchase fruit which she buys wholesale. She's had this business for nine years and relies on her children's support in their free time. She likes what she does as it generates good earnings that allow her to pay for the household expenses and for her children's' education. On the contrary, what she doesn't like is the physical tiredness due to her age. For this reason she rests for up to two days and then returns to her business. She has plans to build a pig farm in order to give her husband an occupation and mutually support one another with the earnings. She also sells beauty products from catalogs.

This is her eighth loan with the MFP institution and she feels happy for the opportunity to have a loan with which to progress her business. Apart from feeling good about her communal bank she considers them nice and responsible people.

With the requested total of 4000 nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of grower's wholesale fruit, the construction of a pig farm, and the purchase of a pregnant sow valued at 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy fruit and invest in a new business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 socias, quienes viven por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación la misma que nos permite disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, gentil, trabajadora que se dedican a la cría de animales, agricultura, comercio y muchos salen a diario para laborar en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas. Nuestras socias son mujeres que nunca se rinden a pesar de las adversidades que tienen que luchar día a día, se caracterizan por mantener su alegría y sus ganas de salir adelante, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten tener su solvencia económica, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad y su último hijo en una escuelita de la localidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa que es prestada.
 
Doña Ana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su familia, como pasa la mayor parte  del tiempo en casa se dedica criar ganado, pollos y cuyes a los que vende en su comunidad. También siembra y  la cosecha que obtiene de sus campos es solo para su consumo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es que todos sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'Nuevo Amanecer' (New Dawn) community bank has eight members who all live in Zhidmad parish, Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by lush vegetation which allows the people here to enjoy nature.  The locals are kind, hard-working people who raise animals, farm and sell products.  Many of them go to the city every day to work in different activities.  The members of this group are women who never give up, in spite of the difficulties that they have to face every day.  They are noted for maintaining their good humor and a desire to do well in life.  The women work in different business activities which allow them to remain financially solvent.  They also maintain the culture and tradition of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is 37-year-old Ana.  Ana is divorced but she has three children from her marriage who are 15, 14 and 12 years old.  Her two older children attend high school in the city and her youngest attends middle school.  Ana does not own her own home.  She lives in a house that she is borrowing.

Ana takes care of her housework and her family.  As is the case with many women in this situation, she also raises livestock, chickens and guinea pigs at home and then sells them in her community.  She also grows crops for her family's own consumption.

Ana has been a member of the community bank for ten years.  She will invest her new loan in buying chickens and feed for her animals.  Her dream is for all of her children to become professionals.

The small photo is of a member who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo 47 años, es un hombre decidido y trabajador, además de alegre y muy cordial.  Está casado con Doris, la madre de sus tres hijos: Eduardo de 24 años, José de 23 años y Liz de 19 años. 
Su actividad es la recuperación de madera. Consiste en la transformación de desperdicios de madera en listones pequeños, palitos para escobas, tablillas y paqueterías. Para eso cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado al interior de un aserradero que le provee de los desperdicios de la madera. Se inició hace más de 25 años en este oficio con la ayuda de su esposa, ahora cuenta con ayudantes, brindando trabajo a por lo menos 15 personas. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su oficio, pues le permite tener ingresos económicos que le ayudan a pagar los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos, apoyándose mutuamente con su esposa. Por otro lado, comenta que tiene deseos de tener un local en alguna zona comercial de la capital (Lima), asociándose con su hermano para realizar la venta directa en la capital, aumentando sus ganancias.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más desechos de madera.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 47 years old and is a hardworking dedicated man.  He is also happy and very friendly.  He is married to Doris, the mother of his three children: 24 year old Eduardo, 23 year old Jose, and 19 year old Luz.


His business consists of recovering lumber.  He transforms small discarded sections of lumber into broom poles, planks, and wooden boxes.  He has a small workshop within a small sawmill that provides him with discarded lumber.  He started this business more than 25 years ago with his wife’s help.  Now he has helpers and provides employment to at least 15 persons.  He considers his business to be profitable because of the demand and the good earnings.  He likes this trade because it allows him to have an income that helps him pay to feed and educate his children, and support his wife mutually.  On the other hand, he says that he wants to have a location in the commercial zone of the capital city (Lima), partnering with his brother to sell in the capital city and increase his income.

 
This will be his second loan through MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has some financial support to advance with his business.  On the other hand he says that he likes the communal bank because he considers the members to be responsible people.


With this loan of 1,500 PEN, he will invest in more discarded lumber.

loans.use: to buy discarded lumber.

loans.name: Gredel

texts.es:
Gredel tiene 41 años, es una mujer entusiasta y con muchas ganas de progresar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Está casada con Kevin, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus dos hijos: Bruno de 22 años y Linda de 20 años, a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instados en la casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza (maquillaje, tintes, esmaltes, labiales, perfumes, etc.) Todos los productos son comprados por catálogo y vendidos desde su casa entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, también hace entregas a domicilio. Se diferencia por su trato amable y cordial, por eso sus clientes la recomiendan con otras personas. Empezó con este oficio hace más de 18 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola, tanto en la venta como en la cobranza. No tenía problema económicos antes de iniciar su negocio, pero decidió aventurarse por la invitación de una amiga y el deseo de sentirse una próspera empresaria e independiente. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en compra de más productos de belleza para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Gredel, 41 years old, is an enthusiastic woman with many desires to progress and give her family a better quality of life. She is married to Kevin, who is a shopkeeper and the father of their two children: Bruno, 22, and Linda, 20, who they love very much. They live together comfortably in the house they built with much effort and dedication.

Gredel makes a living by selling beauty products (make-up, dye, nail polish, lipstick, perfume, etc.). All the products are bought through a catalogue and sold from her house to her acquaintances, friends, and neighbors. She also makes deliveries. She stands out because of her kind and cordial treatment. For this reason, her customers recommend her to others. She started this business over 18 years ago and manages both the selling and billing herself. She did not have economic problems before starting her business, but she decided to venture out after a friend's invitation and the desire to feel like a prosperous and independent businesswoman.

This is her third loan with the MFP institution. She is happy to know that she will have financial help in order to continue with her plans. This is why she promises to be punctual with the payments, like with the other loans. She also mentions that she is comfortable with the communal bank since she knows the members and considers them kind and supportive.

With the sum requested, 2000 nuevo soles, she will invest in buying more beauty products to increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana  tiene  40  años de edad,  es separada  y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, Liliana  actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “Madres Laboriosas” grupo  conformado por 15  socios que se dedica a la venta de  actividades de comercio.  Liliana   se dedica a la venta de plantas este negovio esta situdo en la calle a su vez vende tamales los días domingo. Liliana  inicia este negocio a raiz de su separacion, tuvo que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   a hecho piso en su casa y cuartos, sus ingresos se siguen incrementando y sobre todo sus hijos cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida . Liliana ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia plantas.  Liliana  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Liliana is 40 years old, separated, and has two school-aged children. She is currently a member of the communal bank “Madres Laboriosas,” a group made up of fifteen members that make livings selling their trades. Liliana makes a living selling plants. This business is situated on the street and in turn she sells tamales on Sundays. She began this business as a result of her separation and had to work very hard to get her children ahead. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has put a floor in in her home and rooms. Her earnings continue to increase and above all, her children have a better quality of life. Liliana has requested a new loan to buy plant merchandise. She will fulfill her goals with a lot of work and effort, and the loan from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy plants.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 19 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, todavía soltera, pero madre de una pequeña de 7 meses llamada Sol. Vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus cuatro  hermanos, quienes la apoyan en la crianza de su hija.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, la cual prepara en su casa y entrega diariamente a 15  trabajadores de un aserradero cercano a su casa con los que tiene un trato y les cobra semanalmente. Se inició hace más de 6 meses, con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo la cogida que tenía decidió continuar y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, compartiendo sus ganancias con ella. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias.
Decidió empezar con este negocio debido a la necesidad de contar con un oficio y un ingreso económico para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hija, ya que se separó de su pareja.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está contenta de saber que tendrá acceso a un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus  integrantes y los considera personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina (ollas, platos, vasos y otros) para renovar los que tiene y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. También adquirirá víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de los almuerzos.
texts.en:
Graciela, age 19, is a hard-working and diligent young woman.  She is single, but she has a little seven month old child named Sol.  She lives in her parents’ house with her four siblings, and they help her raise her child.

She sells food that she prepares at home.  She delivers it every day to 15 sawmill workers close to her house.  She has an agreement with them, and she charges weekly.  She started over six months ago with her own capital, and she prepared small quantities.  Upon seeing how her food was received, she decided to continue.  She now has her mother’s help, and she shares her income with her mother.

She considers her business to be very profitable because she almost always sells everything she has prepared, which leaves her with good income.  She decided to start with this business because she needed to have a job.  She needed to have an income in order to cover her expenses and those of her daughter because she is separated from her life partner.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is happy knowing that she will have financial support to realize her plans.  Also, she says that she is comfortable with her communal bank.  She knows the majority of the members, and she considers them to be kind and responsible people.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy kitchen utensils (pots, plates, glasses, and others) to replenish what she has and to provide better service to her customers.  She will also get supplies and ingredients to prepare the lunches.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está casada con Walter, quien es empleado y el padre de sus tres hijos: Aron de 8 años, Josué de 3 años y Natanael de un año. Vive en la casa de sus suegros, con ellos, sus hijos, su pareja y un sobrino, a los que quiere mucho.
Su negocio es la venta de frutas frescas en el frontis de su vivienda. Para eso se levanta muy temprano, se dirige al mercado a comprar las frutas recién llegadas y las más frescas para luego llevarlas a su casa donde las pone a la venta. Empezó hace 6 meses y paralelo vende refrescos, ella atiende personalmente a sus clientes, aprovechando que es una zona muy transitada por estar cerca a los aserraderos. Le gusta lo que hace porque le generan bueno ingresos económicos para vivir de una manera cómoda, además de contar con lo que gana su pareja, pues ello fue lo que utilizó como capital inicial. Ahora tiene planes de invertir en un nuevo producto, las raspadillas, que son hielo molido con jarabes de distintos sabores, muy demandado en la zona por el calor que hace.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente contente contenta con el apoyo financiero para crecer con sus negocios. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera que sus miembros son personas muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de una máquina de raspadillas, valorizada en 500 nuevos soles. Con el saldo compra las frutas frescas para seguir con las ventas.
texts.en:
Rosemary, 27 years old, is a hard-working woman. She is married to Walter, who is employed and is the father of their three children: Aron, 8, Josué, 3, and Natanael, 1. She lives at her in-laws' house with them, her children, her partner and, a nephew who she all loves very much.

Her business is selling fresh fruit in front of her house. Therefore, she wakes up very early, goes to the market to buy the freshest fruit that has just arrived to then brings it home where she sells it. She began 6 months ago and also sells drinks. She personally attends to her customers, taking advantage of the fact that her area is very busy due to being close to the sawmill. She likes what she does because it brings her a good income to live comfortably, in addition to depending on what her partner earns, since she used his capital to start her business. Now she has plans to invest in a new product: snow cones, which are ground ice with different flavors of syrup. There is a high demand for this product in her area because it is very hot.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution and she feels happy for the financial help in order to grow her businesses. In addition to being comfortable with the communal bank, she thinks that the members are very supportive people.

With the sum requested, 1500 nuevo soles, she will invest in buying a snow cone machine, valued at 500 nuevo soles. With the balance, she will buy fresh fruit to continue with these sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit and invest in a new business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de alegre y sociable.  Está separada del padre de sus hijos. Actualmente vive en compañía de su hija de 30 años y sus dos nietos, habitando un la casa que es de su propiedad.
Ella se dedica a la costura, tiene un taller de confección de ropa que instaló en su casa. Este oficio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comenzar con su negocio. Compró primero una pequeña máquina de coser y haciendo prendas a sus vecinos y amistades, así logró hacerse conocida y ganar más clientes, logrando crecer y comprar otras máquinas que facilitan su trabajo y mejoran los acabados. Lleva  realizando esta actividad 20 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.  Le gusta, pues es su vocación y le da la oportunidad de elaborar nuevos diseños. Tiene planes de ampliar su espacio de trabajo y poder tener una boutique en ese mismo lugar.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado para poder avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse cómoda con el grupo de su banco comunal, ya que los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales (telas, hilos, botones y otros), además de la reparación de su máquina de coser.
texts.en:
Juana is forty-nine years old and a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, in addition to being happy and sociable. She is separated from the father of her children. She currently lives with her daughter of 30 years and her two grandchildren in a house that is her property.

She makes a living sewing and has a tailoring workshop for clothes that she opened in her home. She learned this trade at an occupational educational center in order to then begin her business. She first bought a small sewing machine, making garments for her neighbors and friends. In this way she achieved becoming well-known and won more customers, managing to grow and buy other machines that make her work easier and improve the finishes. She has been doing this work for twenty years and until this time has done it by herself. She likes it as it's her vocation and gives her the opportunity to make new designs. She has plans to expand her work space and be able to have a boutique in the same place.

This is her second loan with the MFP institution and she feels grateful for the loan granted to her to be able to progress her business, in addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank's group as she considers them to be responsible and supportive people.

With the requested total of 1500 nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of materials (fabric, thread, buttons, and other items) in addition to repairing her sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable.  Su pareja es Robinson, el padre de sus tres hijos: Isaac de 13 años, Cristian de 9 años y Brenda de 5 años. 
Su negocio es la venta de comida. Lo realiza de lunes a viernes, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes y logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, pues tiene contrato con 35 obreros de un aserradero cercano a su casa, a quienes les cobra semanalmente. Lleva realizando este negocio hace más de 2 años y cuenta con la ayuda ocasional de su pareja y sus hijos. Le gusta cocinar, aprendió de su madre los secretos para una buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico, ya que tienen que levantarse muy temprano por las mañanas para realizar los preparativos del día, pero eso no la desanima. Por eso, para el futuro desea tener una bodega en su casa.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera concretar sus planes. Además, dice estar cómoda con su banco comunal, ya que considera a sus miembros personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de víveres e ingredientes para la comida que prepara diariamente.
texts.en:
Rocío, 33-years-old, is a hard-working and determined woman, in addition to being happy and friendly.  Her partner is Robinson, the father of her three children: 13-year-old Isaac, 9-year-old Cristian, and 5-year-old Brenda.  Her business is selling food.  She works Monday through Friday, attending very kindly to her customers and managing to have good reception and demand, since she has a contract with 35 workers at a sawmill near her home.  She charges them weekly.  

She has been doing this work for more than two years and relies on the occasional help from her partner and children.  She likes to cook (she learned the secrets to a good seasoning from her mother) as well as the financial income that allows her to pay the bills and household expenses.  What she doesn't like is the physical fatigue from having to get up very early in the morning in order to make the preparations for the day, but this does not discourage her.  This is why, in the future, she wants to have a small shop in her home.

This is her sixth loan from the MFP institution, which she hopes will bring her plans to life.  She also says that she is comfortable with her communal bank, since she considers the members to be responsible people.  With the requested amount, 3800 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of provisions and ingredients for the food that she prepares daily.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a married mother of six from northern Israel. After her husband became ill, Suha took over the business and saved it from bankruptcy. Originally the business was part of a chain whose main store was in a neighboring city, but under Suha’s management, they broke away from the chain and she now manages the store independently. The store has clientele from throughout her village and the surrounding area. She now sells sports and women's shoes.

Suha needed this loan to purchase an awning for the store’s entrance, an air conditioner, a new cash register and additional stock.

Suha wants to see her business expand and plans to begin business management courses, which will assist her in her business’s growth.

loans.use: To purchase an awning for the store’s entrance, an air conditioner, a new cash register and stock.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena,de 46 años de edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos cuatro de ellos estan estudiando, y una de ellas ya esta graduada,nos cuenta que con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposo a logrado salir adelante y mantener su negocio,ella se dedica a la distribucion de aguas gaseosas en las diferentes tiendas de la comunidad donde ella vive,poco a poco a salido adelante hoy en dia tiene un deposito de aguas gaseosas,actual mente le surte a una aldea completa cerca del pueblo, su mayor anhelo es ber a sus hijos graduados para que ellos algun dia tengan un trabajo y puedan seguir apoyandola en todo.
texts.en: Maria Elena, 46 years old, is married and has 5 children. Four of them are in school and one of them has graduated. She tells us that with the help of her children and her husband, she has been able to move forward and maintain her business. She makes a living by distributing soda to different stores in the community where she lives. Little by little, she has moved forward and now she has a soda warehouse. Currently, she supplies a whole village near her town. Her greatest wish is to see her children graduate so that someday they will have a job and be able to continue helping her with everything.

loans.use: to buy soda for distribution

loans.name: Estefita

texts.es:
Estefita tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Está casada con Rodrigo, quien es comerciante y el padre de sus dos hijos: Kevin de 17 años y Sarai de 6 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijos y un hermano.
Su actividad es la venta de madera, cuenta con bastantes compradores, para esto alquiló un local donde almacena su madera y la exhibe al público. Realiza esta actividad hace más de 7 años, contando con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de las compras en los aserraderos de la localidad y ella de la atención al público. Le gusta lo que hace porque le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, quienes son su motivación para seguir trabajando y buscar salir adelante. Ahora tiene planes de aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y ampliar el espacio de su local para aumentar la capacidad de almacenaje.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Se siente bien con su banco comunal, pues lo considera un grupo bastante concertador.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de madera para los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Estefita is 32 years old, and is hard-working and enterprising woman who is eager to get ahead. She is married to Rodrigo, who is a shopkeeper and the father of her two children: Kevin who is 17 years old and Sarai who is 6 years old. She lives with her husband, her children and a brother. 

She works selling wood. She has many buyers, so she has hired a premises  where she stores her wood and exhibits to the public. She has been carrying on this work for 7 years, and has the support of her husband, who takes care of the sawmills so that she can serve the public. She likes what she does because it provides her with an income with which she can pay the household expenses and the education of her children, who are her motivation to continue working, and try to get ahead. She now how plans to increase her sales volume and expand the space of her shop to increase the storage capacity. 

This is her loan number 10 with the institution MFP. She is happy with the communal bank, as she considers it to be a harmonious group. With the amount she is asking for, 2000 nueves soles, she will buy wood for her outstanding orders

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 19 años, es una joven empeñosa y trabajadora, con muchas ansias de sobresalir y construirse un futuro mejor. Su pareja es Darwin, quien es mecánico. Vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y su pareja.
Su actividad es la  venta de abarrotes, para esto implementó una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde acondicionó y acomodó todos los productos necesarios y más solicitados por sus clientes, a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial. Se inició hace 2 años, comprando en pequeñas cantidades con su propio capital, viendo que le daba resultados positivos decidió continuar. También vende refrescos y queques en los aserraderos cercanos a su casa, hasta el momento le ayuda su madre en la atención al público. 
Viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional para solventar sus gastos y pagar sus estudios superiores, buscó alternativas y se decidió por este negocio. Por tanto, tiene planes de comprar un mayor volumen para ver crecer su bodega.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir en el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores y de esa manera tener acceso a más créditos en un futuro. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general,  en mayor volumen para tener un stock disponible, teniendo en cuenta las preferencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 19, is a diligent and hard-working young woman.  She is very eager to excel and to build a better future.  Her life partner, Darwin, is a mechanic.  She lives with her life partner and her parents in their house.

She sells groceries.  She established a small grocery store in her house.  She arranged it and fit in all of the necessary and most requested customer products.  She tends to her customers in a kind and friendly way.  She started two years ago by purchasing in small quantities with her own capital.  Upon seeing the positive results that she got, she decided to continue.  She also sells soft drinks and cakes at the saw mills that are close to her house.  Now her mother helps her tend to the public.

Seeing the need to have an additional income to cover her expenses and pay for her higher education, she looked for alternatives and decided on this business.  Therefore, she plans on buying a greater volume in order to see her grocery store grow.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support to advance with her business.  She pledges to make her payments as she did with the previous loans.  This way she will have access to more loans in the future.  She says that she is comfortable with her communal bank.  She knows the members, and she considers them to be responsible and supportive people.

She will use the requested 2,500 soles to buy general groceries in greater volume, keeping in mind her customers’ preferences.  She will do this to have stock available.

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store.

loans.name: José Félix

texts.es:
Don José tiene 62 años de edad, es viudo y tiene cuatro hijos. Él durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas, fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron. Los insumos los compra en una ciudad que esta a veinte minutos de su casa y los compra más baratos.

Él solicita un préstamo a la Fundación Campo, para comprar tres vacas y dos sacos de abono para su cultivo de maíz. Con la compra de las vacas podrá generar un ingreso extra a  su casa supliendo la necesidad de tener leche y queso para su familia al mismo tiempo que ahorrara su compra. Don José desea tener varias vacas para vender queso en toda su comunidad ya que es muy escaso allí y considera que obtendría ganancias.
texts.en:
Don José is 62, is a widower, and has four children.  Throughout his life he has made a living through agricultural work; it was his parents who taught him.  He buys his materials in a city that is 20 minutes from his house, and where the purchase is cheaper.  

He asks for a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy three cows and two sacks of fertilizer for his cultivation of corn.  With the purchase of the cows he will be able to generate extra income for his home, fulfilling the need to have milk and cheese for his family and at the same time he will save having to purchase these.  Don José wishes to have several cows in order to sell cheese throughout all of his community since it is very limited there and he believes that he would make a profit.

loans.use: to buy three cows and two sacks of fertilizer for his cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Fuerza Al Exito Group

texts.es:
FUERZA AL ÉXITO es una alcancía recién formada, sus 8 integrantes son amigos y compañeros de trabajo de la misma Zona Los Olivos Lima Perú. El Sr. David ha sido elegido el presidente del grupo cargo que espera desempeñar con mucha responsabilidad. David se dedica al transporte público tiene un auto en alquiler con el que  hace taxi, su trabajo le permite distribuir su tiempo y  ayudar  a su único hijo en sus estudios universitarios, ya son 10 años que trabaja haciendo servicio público y  lo que más desea es comprarse su auto propio, con su  primer préstamo realizara mantenimiento mecánico al carro  con el que trabaja y seguirá ahorrando para lograr sus objetivos.

*David viste polo a rayas plomo y esta parado.
texts.en:
"Fuerza al Exito" is a recently formed communal bank.  It has 8 members who are friends and work colleagues from the Los Olivos neighborhood of Lima, Peru.  David has been elected president of the group, a role that he hopes to perform with a lot of responsibility.  David works in public transportation.  He has a rented automobile that he uses as a taxi.  His work allows him to allocate his time and help his only son with his university education.  He has already been working in public transportation for 10 years, and what he would like the most is to be able to buy his own car.  With this first loan, he will do maintenance work on the car he uses for his work, and he will continue to save to reach his goals.

Note: In the picture, David is the one standing in the striped grey shirt.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Dolca

texts.es:
Dolca tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Su pareja es Edwin, el padre de sus cuatro hijos: Milagros de 15 años, Sonia de 13 años, Nisy de 6 años y Edwin de 21 años de edad. Todos viven en la casa de su suegra.
Su actividad es la venta de madera. Compra toda su mercadería en los aserraderos locales y tiene compradores locales y foráneos. Empezó con esto hace 5 meses, contando con el apoyo de su pareja, quien se encarga de la compra de la madera y ella de la atención de los clientes. Le su trabajo porque cuenta con un ingreso económico que le permite salir de apuros y pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Se decidió por este negocio porque es tranquilo y su pareja la puede remplazar cuando ella no se encuentra. Ahora, viendo los resultados positivos que está obteniendo, tiene planes de seguir e incrementar el volumen de sus ventas.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por eso espera concretar sus planes. Además, comenta sentirse cómoda y bien con su banco comunal, pues sus integrantes son personas solidarias y amables.
Con el monto solicitado, de 3500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más madera, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolca, 46, is a very hardworking and industrious woman.  Her partner is Edwin, the father of her 4 children: Milagros, aged 15, Sonia, aged 13, Nisy, aged 6, and Edwin, aged 21.  They all live together in her mother-in-law's house.

Dolca has a business buying wood.  She buys all of her merchandise from the area sawmills, and she has local and foreign buyers.  She started in this business 5 months ago, relying on the support of her partner.  He is in charge of buying the wood, and she takes care of the customers.  She likes her work, because she can rely on an income that will allow her to avoid financial difficulties and pay for the education of her children. She decided on this line of work because it is tranquil and her partner can take her place when she is not available to work.  Now, seeing the positive results that she is getting, she has plans to continue and expand her sales volume.

This is her 6th loan with the MFP institution, and so she expects to carry out her plans.  Also, she comments that she feels comfortable and good about her communal bank, as the members are cooperative and friendly.

With the sum of 3,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will invest in the purchase of more wood, looking to make her purchases at low prices by buying in bulk, so that she can have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Martha Rebeca

texts.es: Martha tiene 39 años y está casada con Ibaldis de momento no tiene hijos pero están en planes de ampliar su familia. Ella tiene un deposito de bebidas ubicado en Duran en la casa de su propiedad. El negocio lo abrió hace 12 años empezó vendiendo solo colas desde la ventana de su casa pero con el tiempo fue creciendo y aumentando los productos. El dinero para la apertura de su negocio lo obtuvo de la liquidación cuando fue despedida de su trabajo. En la actualidad tiene un local que construyo en su domicilio y tiene muchos productos. El trabajo lo realiza sola desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Martha nos comenta que sus clientes están enseñados a su trato y cuando deja encargado a su esposo o familiar no les gusta. Ibaldis el esposo de Martha se dedica al comercio de mariscos y es con su aporte que mantiene la economía de su hogar. Con el préstamo comprara colas, jugos para aumentar sus ventas. El sueño de Martha a futuro es hacer otro local en donde su esposa venda sus mariscos sin tener que recorrer…también aumentar su familia.
texts.en: Martha is 39 years old and is married to Ibaldis. At the moment, they do not have any children but they have plans to expand their family. She has a drinks deposit located in Duran, in the house on her property. She opened the business twelve years ago. She started selling only with colas from the window of her house but, over time, it grew and she expanded the products. She obtained the money for the opening of her business from the liquidation when she was let go from her job. Currently, she has a shop that she built in her home and she has a lot of products. She performs her work from 6AM until 9PM. Martha tells us that her customers are used to her treatment and when she leaves her husband or a family member in charge, they don't like it. Ibaldis, Martha's husband, is dedicated to selling seafood and it is with his support that she maintains her home finances. With the loan, she will buy colas and juices to expand her sales. Martha's dream in the future is to start another shop where her husband sells seafood without having to travel... also to expand her family.

loans.use: to buy colas and juices.

loans.name: Hurng

texts.en:
Hurng, aged 39, is a married father of four children, three of whom are dependent on him. Two of his dependent children are still in primary school. He and his wife sell fish paste, grilled fish, and dried fish to make a living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district. He also earns extra income as a motor taxi driver. He has been in his primary business for almost eight years. The main challenge for his family is the lessened demand for his product. 
This is the fifth loan with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, and he successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped his family increase business and the family's income. With a good business, he is requesting a loan with VisionFund. He will use this loan to buy more fish for his business. He hopes to increase his business and make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy more fish for his business.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Rosa Rojas está formado por 10 socias, quienes laboran a diario en diferentes actividades en especial las del campo, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. El cantón Paute tiene un clima cálido el cual es propicio para una gran variedad de flores, también se cosechas las mejores frutas, este lugar tiene varios lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Susana, tiene 41 años de  edad, es  viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María Susana se dedica a las labores cotidianas de su hogar y algunas veces labora cultivando terrenos ajenos, también se dedica a la cría de  cuyes y pollos, cultiva sus terrenos y las cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Se encuentra en el octavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y alimento para sus animales.

Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser buenos profesionales. 

Las tres fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rosa Rojas is made up of ten female members who work daily doing different jobs, especially ones in the countryside. They are nice, kind people and still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. The canton of Paute has a warm climate which is favorable for a great variety of flowers and harvests of the best fruits. This region has various places to visit from which to admire nature's beauty in all its splendor. Its gastronomy is very varied and captivates the palate of its own region and foreign regions.

One of the female members of this group is María Susana. She's 41 years old, a widow, and has three children from her marriage who are 18, 12, and 8 years old. Her first son works and helps her financially, and her last two children are studying at a small school of the locality. The house in which she lives is her property.

Mrs. María Susana makes a living doing the daily work of her home and sometimes works farming other peoples' lands. She also makes a living raising guinea pigs and chicken, and farming her land. The harvests are for the consumption of her household.

This is her eighth loan with the communal bank and she is going to invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs and food for her animals.

Her dream is to give her children a better education and for them to be professionals.

The three small photographs are of three female members that couldn't be present when the group's photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for animals.

loans.name: Corazones Unidos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por 5 socias y 2 socios, quienes laboran en su mayoría en la venta de comida actividad que la desempeñan algunos años, son personas amables, gentiles y de un gran carisma. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de clima frió, esta bañada por 4 ríos y tiene una gran riqueza natural y arquitectónica, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ada, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 3 de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, 2 de sus hijos pasan en casa ayudándole en los quehaceres del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es panificador y también se dedica al comercio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Ada se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito) en la vereda de su casa, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche.

Este es el primer crédito que está realizando en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra gaseosas para dedicarse a la venta de estas y así ampliar su negocio.

Como le gusta mucho cocinar su sueño es tener un comedor. 

Las dos niñas de la foto son hijas de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank Corazones Unidos is made up of 5 women and 2 men who have been working mainly in food sales for some years. They are friendly, gentle, and have charisma. They live in Cuenca, a city with a cold climate, which is bathed by 4 rivers and has great natural richness and architecture, and was given the status of World Heritage site in December of 1999. Its people still keep the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Ada, who is 52 years old. She is married and has 9 children. Three of the children are married and living independently, 2 of the children live at home helping in the household chores and her youngest son studies at a small city school. Her husband is a baker and also works in commerce. They do not own their own home and are renting.

Ada works selling chuzos (meat on a stick) on the pathway of her home, doing this activity for 3 years, working from Sunday to Sunday from 4:00PM in the afternoon until 7:00PM in the evening.

This is her first loan that she is asking for at the communal bank and she will invest the loan in buying soft drinks to expand her business by selling them. 

As she enjoys cooking her dream is to have a dining facility.

The 2 girls pictured in the photo are daughters of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 37-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling beans and maize for six years. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and seasonal weather. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car. His business goals are buying land to grow crops, expanding his business into new markets, and hiring employees to help expand his business. Ibrahim wants money to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Las Escogidas 2 Group

texts.en:
Kenia is the coordinator of her group, Las Escogidas 2. This group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macorís, surrounded by sugar cane fields where there is no potable running water, and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.
Kenia is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza, almost four years after she started doing business and taking out loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells miscellaneous products like clothing, cosmetics and beauty products, and shoes. She will use her profits to start to reinvest and to save. Her most important future plan is to have a house with a nice and safer structure. She likes to work. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy products for her business such as clothing, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Clemencia Del Rocio

texts.es: Clemencia tiene 36 años y está casada con Luis. Vive en Libertad en donde tiene una tienda de víveres y abarrotes. Desde hace 8 años tiene la tienda la cual empezó con un capital propio. Ella nos cuenta que se animo porque en esos tiempos no había muchos comercios por su barrio. En la actualidad ya no es la única y la competencia es dura. Clemencia nos comenta que trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, el cerrar tarde es un factor a favor y el porqué los clientes la prefieren. Nos cuenta que al momento la dificultad que se le presenta es el transporte ya que el pueblo donde se abastece queda lejos. Su esposo Luis es chofer de taxis y mecánico industrial, tiene dos trabajos en los cuales le va muy bien. Sus 3 hijos aun estudian por lo que asisten a la escuela Fiscal de Libertad. Espera con el préstamo comprar arroz, azúcar, confitería esperando con esto tener mayor venta. Su meta futura es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Clemencia is 36 years old and is married to Luis. She lives in Libertad where she has a grocery and general store. She has had the store for 8 years which she opened with her own capital. She tells us that she had the courage to do it because in those days there were not many stores in her neighborhood. Currently she is not the only one and the competition is tough. Clemencia tells us that she works from 7:00AM in the morning until 10:00PM in the evening, and her customers favor her store because she closes so late. We note that at the moment a difficulty for her is transport as the neighborhood where she gets her supplies is far away. Her husband, Luis, is a taxicab driver and industrial mechanic. He has 2 jobs which are going very well. Her 3 children are students and attend the school called Fiscal de Libertad. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, and sweets hoping to improve her sales. Her future goal is improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and sweets

loans.name: Edgar Benito

texts.es:
Edgar es casado tiene 3 hijos quienes estudian cerca de su comunidad, inicio su negocio hace aproximadamente 15 años  le gusta vender , inicio vendiendo  cortinas y colchas de baja calidad,  y ahora el vende la mercadería por cuotas las ventas las realiza 5 días a la semana en diferentes colonias del municipio en donde el vive.
 Para poder vender más rápido la mercadería la vende por mayor, es por eso que él solicita un crédito a Fape/ Kiva para poder seguir invirtiendo en mercaderias de ropa de cama y así poder brindarles educación a sus hijos.
 Su esposa es su mayor apoyo ya que trabajan juntos en dicho negocio,  ahora también venden chicharrones de cerdo los fines de semana y desean seguir trabajando.  Con la ayuda de Dios y este segundo crédito  el cual  les ha  ayudado mucho, ya que están por cumplir uno de los sueños mas grandes que tienen que es terminar de pagar la casa donde ellos viven.
texts.en:
Edgar is married with 3 children, who study nearby his community. He has started his business approximately 15 years ago; he likes selling. Edgar started by selling curtains and bedspreads of lower quality, and now he sells his merchandise in installments. He does his sales 5 days a week, in different colonies of the municipality he lives in.   

In order to sell quicker, he sells the merchandise wholesale, this is why he is requesting a loan from Fape/Kiva, to be able to continue investing in bedclothes merchandise and this way provide his children with education. 

His wife is his greatest support, as they work together in this business; now they also sell pork cracklings during weekends and wish to continue working. With God's help and this second loan which has helped them a lot, they are almost fulfilling one of their biggest dreams, finish paying for the house they live in.

loans.use: to sell bedclothes.

loans.name: José Rene

texts.es:
Don José tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, esta actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le inculcaron valores morales. Cada ocho días desde muy temprano viaja a una ciudad del oriente del país a comprar la mercadería para surtir el negocio. 

Él esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar ropa para dama, caballero y niños, ya que expresa que le es muy rentable. Con el financiamiento aumentara considerablemente las ofertas a sus clientes y a la población en general. Con las  ganancias espera mejorar su calidad de vida, poseer un local propio e instalar otro local de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old, and he is married with 2 children. For 12 years he has been owning a clothes selling business. He learned this trade when he was very young, thanks to the support of his parents, who instilled him with moral values. Every eight days he travels very early to a city in the Eastern part of the country, to buy merchandise to supply the business.  

He is requesting a loan to buy women, men and children's clothes, as he says it is very profitable. With the financing he will considerably increase the supply to his customers and to the population in general. With the profits he hopes to increase his quality of life, own a store of his own, and set up another clothes selling store.

loans.use: to buy women, men and children's clothes.

loans.name: Iliana Doris

texts.es: Iliana tiene 26 años, vive en Playas junto a su familia. Su esposo David se dedica también a la producción y venta de chifles.  Tiene 3 hijos que estudian la escuela fiscal. Iliana empezó su negocio de elaboración de frituras en pocas cantidades, vendía recorriendo las calles con una canasta donde llevaba el producto. Esta forma de venta no le resultaba muy beneficiosa ya que recorría muchos sectores y a veces no vendía ni la mitad de su producto. Después de un tiempo se le ocurrió ofrecer a los puestos de venta de encebollado ya que su demanda es mayor porque permanecen toda la noche abiertos. Con una gran sonrisa nos comenta que fue la mejor idea de su vida. En la actualidad tiene 3 triciclos vendiendo chifles, dos ubicados en escuelas y el otro en el malecón de playas. Tiene siete años con el negocio y le va muy bien, tanto que su esposo es uno de los encargados de la venta. Su día empieza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. Al momento no han tenido ninguna dificultad y esperan continuar de esa manera. Con el préstamo que solicita comprara materia prima para la elaboración y utensilios para el uso. Su mayor sueño el cual no cree inalcanzable es comprar una máquina para la elaboración del producto y formar una microempresa.
texts.en:
Iliana is 26 years old and she lives in Playas with her family. Her husband David works with her producing and selling plantain chips. She has 3 children who are studying at a public school.

Iliana started up her business making fried snacks in small quantities which she sold by walking through the streets with a basket where she carried the product. This method of selling wasn't very profitable for her as she had to cover many districts and sometimes she didn't even sell half of her product. After a while, she thought of offering her product to the food stalls selling 'encebollado', as they have a higher demand because they stay open all night. With a big smile, she tells us that it was the best idea she's ever had. She currently has 3 tricycles selling plantain chips, two located outside schools and the other on the seafront. She has been in this business for seven years and it is going very well for her, so much so that her husband is one of the sales managers. Her day begins at 7am and ends at 11pm. Until now, they haven't had any problems and they hope to continue in this way.
